subject: Re: [junit] Creating unit tests for non returning methods
msgSnippet: ... If the method throws an exception, then you can test for that. Example: public void someMethod(String imput) throws SomeException {
messageBody:
- nyhockeyfan1994 <nyhockeyfan1994@...> wrote:

>
>
> Hello All,
>
> I have used JUnit before, however I have been unable to figure out how
> to test methods that don't have a return value. How do you test those
> types of methods? Do all methods have to return a value to be able to
> develop a test for it?
>
> -Paul


If the method throws an exception, then you can test for that.

Example:

public void someMethod(String imput) throws SomeException
{
if(input.equals(badInput)
throw new SomeException();

else
" lif is good"
}


You then test it with "good" input and "bad" input on your testcase.

void testGood()
{
try{
obj.someMethod("Good Input");
}
catch(SomeException se)
{
fail("Oops.. failed on good input");
}
}

void testBar()
{
try{
obj.someMethod("Good Input");
fail("Oops.. Should have thrown an exception");
}
catch(SomeException se)
{
// test passed.
}
}


Hope this helps.

Harring Figueiredo.
